summary: This is an email chain from July 24, 2019, discussing the management of Jeffrey Epstein while he was on suicide watch at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The emails reveal internal debate about Epstein's status, his attendance at a legal visit while on watch, and skepticism about his account of an injury to his neck.

events.title: Internal Email Debate on Epstein's Status
events.description: Staff at MCC exchanged emails debating the appropriateness of Epstein being on suicide watch, his attendance at a legal visit in regular clothes, and the credibility of his story about a neck injury.

keyFacts: On July 24, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was on suicide watch at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).
Epstein had a 'significant scar' or 'huge scar' on his neck, but his account of how it occurred was met with internal skepticism and described as having 'a ton of dishonesty and holes.'
Despite being on suicide watch, Epstein was allowed to attend a legal visit while wearing regular clothes, a decision that was questioned by staff members Sodhi and Columbo.
Internal emails reveal a debate about the overuse of suicide watch at MCC and contrast it with practices at other detention centers like one in Chicago.
The document suggests Epstein may have had an altercation with a cellmate in the SHU prior to these events.
